page.title: 18D.OF E.AWARD IN APEDALE
page.content: The Duke of Edinburgh's Award scheme is a programme of leisure activities for young people.It challenges youth to serve others, keep physically fit,acquire new skills,make new friends and experience adventure. It is not competitive and anyone with determination,perseverance,enterprise and effort can achieve the award. The Gold award,the highest standard,takes a minimum of 2 years to complete.It cannot be started until participants are 17,and must be completed by the age of 25. This Apedale Gold Award group exists to help young people in a rural area complete the award scheme.At present there are 28 candidates involved,15 boys and 13 girls,most of whom have completed bronze and silver levels at their secondary school.
